Object.Field:
This spceialized IKM was developed for Oracle databases using partitioned tables. Since one of the critical steps requires the exection of the DBMS_METADATA package, apprproriate execution grants must be given to the ODI connection user.
Steps: - Enable parallel DML. - Drop the partition staging table N$_xxxxx (if exists) - Use a CTAS statement to create the N$_xxx target staging table from the target table partition (with or without existing data) - Use an INSERT statement to add source data to the N$_xxx target staging table - Create dependent objects (indexes, constraints) using DBMS_METADATA - Lock the target table partition in SHARED_MODE. - Exchange the target table partition with the partition staging table N$_xxxxx - Disable parallel DML. - Drop the partition staging table N$_xxxxx
Enhancements: 1.) Performs CTAS from C$ tables/sources to N$_xxxx partition stage table, which is then exchanged in target. 2.) Added the ability to seed the Target table using a row limit. Set USE_ROW_LIMIT to true and a sample size for ROW_LIMIT. 3.) Defaulted OPTIMIZER_HINT to use parallelism e.g. /*+ parallel(table1,64) parallel(table2,64) */ 4.) Added alter session parallel statements 5.) Added KEEP_EXISTING_DATA option (If true, user must ensure that duplicate rows are not created when adding new source data)
Commit all data inserted in the target datastore.
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary objects (tables, files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.
Enter the name for the partition variable. You can pass a fixed name or you can use the partition FOR clause.
Hint For Parallelism on Create Tabl
Initial Extent Size for Create Tab
For Large Tables Can make 100G for example
Next Extent Size for Create Table
For large data - can make value large such as 10G
This indicates whether to only load a sample of rows or all the rows in the Big table. The ROW_LIMIT option should be set
This indicates whether to retain the data already existing in the targeted partition. If TRUE, the loading interface must ensure that no duplicate records are created.

create table <%=odiRef.getTargetTable("SCHEMA")%>.N$_<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("RES_NAME")%> ( <%=odiRef.getTargetColList("", "[COL_NAME] ", ",\n\t", "")%> ) nologging storage(initial <%=odiRef.getUserExit("INITIAL_EXTENT_SIZE")%> next <%=odiRef.getUserExit("NEXT_EXTENT_SIZE")%> maxextents unlimited) <%=odiRef.getUserExit("CREATE_PARALLEL_HINT")%> as select * from <%=odiRef.getTargetTable("SCHEMA")%>.<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("RES_NAME")%> partition (<%=odiRef.getUserExit("APARTITION_VARIABLE")%>) <% if (odiRef.getOption("KEEP_EXISTING_DATA").equals("1")) { %> where (1 = 1) <% } else { %> where rownum = 0 <% }; %>

insert into <%=odiRef.getTargetTable("SCHEMA")%>.N$_<%=odiRef.getTargetTable("RES_NAME")%> ( <%=odiRef.getTargetColList("", "[COL_NAME] ", ",\n\t", "")%> ) <%for (int i=0; i < odiRef.getDataSetCount(); i++){%> <%=odiRef.getDataSet(i, "Operator")%> select <%=odiRef.getUserExit("OPTIMIZER_HINT")%> <%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS")%> <%=odiRef.getColList(i,"", "[EXPRESSION]", ",\n\t", "", "((INS) and REW)")%> from <%=odiRef.getFrom(i)%> where <% if (odiRef.getDataSet(i, "HAS_JRN").equals("1")) { %> JRN_FLAG <> 'D' <%} else {%> (1=1) <% } %> <%=odiRef.getJoin(i)%> <%=odiRef.getFilter(i)%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter(i)%> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy(i)%> <%=odiRef.getHaving(i)%> <%}%>
